Class PID

java.lang.Object
MRILib.motion.PID
Direct Known Subclasses:
HeadingPID
public class PID extends Object
Implements a standard Proportional-Integral-Derivative (PID) controller.

A PID controller calculates an "error" value as the difference between a measured process variable and a desired setpoint. The controller attempts to minimize the error over time by adjustment of a control variable (output).

This implementation includes:

  • Proportional (P) term: Proportional to the current error.
  • Integral (I) term: Accumulates past errors (integrates) to eliminate steady-state error. Includes an integral windup limit (iLimit) and clamping (errorSumTotal).
  • Derivative (D) term: Based on the rate of change of the error, used to dampen oscillations.
This version also includes an overload for the `update` method that selects between two input values.
See Also:
  • PID Controller (Wikipedia)
  • ElapsedTime

  • Field Details

    • kP

      public double kP
      Proportional gain (kP). Determines the reaction to the current error. Typically positive.

    • kI

      public double kI
      Integral gain (kI). Determines the reaction based on the sum of recent errors. Typically positive.

    • kD

      public double kD
      Derivative gain (kD). Determines the reaction based on the rate at which the error has been changing. Typically positive.

    • iLimit

      public double iLimit
      Integral limit (I-Zone). The absolute error must be less than this value for the integral term to accumulate. Helps prevent integral windup when the error is large. Must be non-negative. Defaults to 1.

    • targetVal

      public double targetVal
      The desired setpoint or target value for the controller.

    • errorSum

      double errorSum
      The accumulated integral error sum.

    • errorSumTotal

      public double errorSumTotal
      The maximum absolute value the integral error sum (errorSum) is allowed to reach. Helps prevent integral windup by clamping the accumulated error. Must be non-negative. Defaults to 0.1.

    • lastTime

      double lastTime
      Timestamp of the last update(double) call, used for calculating delta time.

    • lastError

      double lastError
      The error calculated during the previous update(double) call, used for calculating the derivative term.

    • timer

      com.qualcomm.robotcore.util.ElapsedTime timer
      Timer used to calculate the time difference (deltaTime) between updates.

  • Constructor Details

    • PID

      public PID(double p, double i, double d)
      Constructs a new PID controller with specified gains. Initializes the internal timer.
      Parameters:
      p - The proportional gain (kP).
      i - The integral gain (kI).
      d - The derivative gain (kD).

  • Method Details

    • start

      public void start()
      Resets the PID controller's internal state. Zeros the integral sum and last error, and resets the timer. Should be called before starting a new control sequence or after significant changes (like changing the target value drastically, depending on the application).

    • update

      public double update(double current)
      Updates the PID controller calculation based on a single measured value. Calculates the P, I, and D terms based on the current measurement and the target value, and returns the calculated control output.
      Parameters:
      current - The current measured value of the process variable.
      Returns:
      The calculated control output value (e.g., motor power, servo position adjustment).

    • update

      public double update(double current1, double current2)
      Updates the PID controller calculation by choosing between two measured values. It selects the input value (`current1` or `current2`) that is closer (smaller absolute difference) to the `targetVal` and then calls the primary update(double) method with the selected value.
      Parameters:
      current1 - The first possible measured value.
      current2 - The second possible measured value.
      Returns:
      The calculated control output based on the input value closer to the target.

    • setTarget

      public void setTarget(double target)
      Sets the desired target value (setpoint) for the PID controller.
      Parameters:
      target - The new target value.

    • setILimit

      public void setILimit(double limit)
      Sets the integral limit (I-Zone). The integral term will only accumulate when the absolute error is below this limit. Ensures the limit is non-negative.
      Parameters:
      limit - The maximum absolute error for integral accumulation.

    • setIntegralSumLimit

      public void setIntegralSumLimit(double limit)
      Sets the clamping limit for the integral sum. The absolute value of the accumulated integral error (errorSum) will not exceed this limit. Ensures the limit is non-negative.
      Parameters:
      limit - The maximum absolute value for the integral sum.
